properties.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued January 11 at 3:48AM CST until January 11 at 5:15AM CST by NWS Memphis TN
properties.description:
At 347 AM CST, flooding continued across portions of central
Craighead County. Around 2 inches of rain fell in a brief period of
time, inundating some low-lying roads, making them impassable. Light
to moderate rain will continue through the remainder of the night
but floodwaters are expected to gradually recede.

HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain.

SOURCE...Radar indicated.

IMPACT...Flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas,
highways, streets and underpasses as well as other drainage
and low lying areas.

Some locations that will experience flooding include...
Jonesboro, Bono, Bay, Brookland, Hergett, Apt, Herman, Valley View,
Farrville, Gilkerson, Otwell, Cary, Herndon, Goobertown, Needham and
Craighead Forest Park.
properties.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood
deaths occur in vehicles.

Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the
dangers of flooding.

Excessive runoff from heavy rainfall will cause flooding of small
creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as
well as other drainage areas and low lying spots.

NWSheadline: THE FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 AM CST FOR CENTRAL CRAIGHEAD COUNTY
